vectorData.altText: That's right!  A is indicating the sympathetic chain. Sympathetic ganglia can be seen as small enlargements along the chain at each intercostal space.
That is incorrect. Click here     to learn the answer, then come back to try again.
sympathetic chains. Trace the sympathetic chains inferiorly, along the length of the thoracic cavity.
IDENTIFY, connecting each intercostal nerve with its corresponding ganglion,
the white and grey rami communicantes. They can be differentiated on the basis of the fact that the white rami are lateral to the grey rami.

Observe that the sympathetic chains gradually move medially, starting at the necks of the first ribs, then, more inferiorly, crossing the heads of the ribs, and finally at the lower thoracic levels, lying more anteriorly, on the lateral aspect of the T10 -T12 vertebral bodies. Notice that there is one sympathetic ganglion corresponding to each intercostal space. This is unlike in the cervical region, where there are three ganglion, superior (stellate), middle and inferior.
